intro: Stachytarpheta cearensis, commonly known as Brazilian violet or cearensis verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Stachytarpheta cearensis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooms.
